Linux 6.16.1 Fixes Intel GPU Driver Performance Regression

high

The Linux kernel version 6.16.1 addresses a significant performance regression in the Intel i915 GPU driver, affecting Core Ultra 7 155H 'Meteor Lake' laptops and other systems with up to 30% drop in GPU texture bandwidth testing.

  • Intel i915 GPU Driver
  • Performance Regression Fix
  • Up To 30% Performance Improvement
  • Commit acd7ccb284b8
  • Linux Kernel Version 6.16.1
Backend/TargetCommit acd7ccb284b8GPUGPU PerformanceIntel i915 DriverLinux KernelOthersPerformancePerformance RegressionRegressionRelease

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Linux-6.16.1-Fixes-Intel-i915

Ghostty GTK Application Rewrite

medium

Mitchell Hashimoto has rewritten the Ghostty GTK application to fully embrace the GObject type system, leading to improvements in memory management and easier creation of custom GTK widgets. This rewrite also allows for the use of modern GTK UI technologies such as Blueprint.

  • Project/Component: Ghostty
  • Target Architecture: GTK
  • Optimization/IR/Pass Name: Full embrace of GObject type system
  • Version/Release: Expected in the next few weeks, to be included in version 1.2
  • Performance Impact: Improved memory management and easier introduction of GUI features
  • Related PR/Commit/Discussion Links: https://lwn.net/Articles/1033954/
BlueprintGObject type systemGTKGhostty

https://lwn.net/Articles/1033954/

Security Updates for Multiple Distributions

high

This report consolidates security updates across multiple Linux distributions including AlmaLinux, Debian, Fedora, Oracle, and SUSE.

  • AlmaLinux kernel update in versions 8, 9, and 10
  • Debian security advisories for packages like aide, postgresql-13, chromium, apache2, openjdk-17, pgpool2
  • Fedora updates for libtiff, mupdf, pandoc, glib2, matrix-synapse, openjpeg, python3-docs, and python3.13
  • Oracle Linux security advisories for packages like git, kernel, gdk-pixbuf2, glibc, java-1.8.0-openjdk
  • SUSE updates for ImageMagick, Mesa, cairo, chromium
linux distributionssecurityupdates

Generic VFIO Platform Driver To Be Marked As Deprecated For Removal

medium

Red Hat engineer Alex Williamson posted patches to begin deprecating some unmaintained code, including the vfio-fsl-mc driver which has been orphaned since April 2024. The vfio-platform and vfio-amba drivers have an active maintainer but lack testing capabilities due to obsolete hardware.

  • vfio-fsl-mc driver marked as deprecated
  • vfio-platform and vfio-amba drivers also affected
  • Hardware for these drivers has become obsolete
  • Lack of ability to test the drivers upstream
DeprecationLinux VirtualizationRed HatVFIO

https://www.phoronix.com/news/VFIO-Platform-Deprecated

AMD Posts 11th Iteration Of Color Pipeline API For Advanced Color Management On Linux

low

Ubuntu 25.10 Enters Its Feature Freeze Period

medium

With the beginning of the feature freeze, the Ubuntu development focus shifts primarily to testing and fixing bugs ahead of the anticipated 9 October release date. But feature freeze exceptions can be granted for those developers with late features to land. New point releases of software that don't introduce new features can also continue to land.

  • Ubuntu 25.10 enters its feature freeze period
  • Linux 6.17 kernel
  • GNOME 49 desktop atop Wayland
  • RISC-V support baseline ups to RVA23 profile
  • TPM-backed full disk encryption support
  • sudo-rs and other Rust-based components
  • Chrony by default
  • Dracut used by default
ChronyDracutGNOMELinux KernelRISC-VTPM-backed EncryptionUbuntuWaylandsudo-rs

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Ubuntu-25.10-Feature-Freeze

VirtualBox 7.2 Released With Windows 11 ARM Support, Linux 6.16 Compatibility

medium

Notable with VirtualBox 7.2 is now supporting VirtualBox on Windows 11 on Arm both as the host platform and then also VirtualBox VM Guest Additions support for Windows 11 on Arm guests. VirtualBox 7.2 also brings improvements to its user interface, compatibility with the Linux 6.16 kernel, Windows Hyper-V integration enhancements, and a variety of other fixes and improvements.

  • VirtualBox 7.2
  • Windows 11 ARM Support
  • Linux 6.16 Compatibility
  • User Interface Improvements
  • Windows Hyper-V Integration Enhancements
Linux Kernel CompatibilityVirtualBoxWindows 11 ARM

AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO 9995WX Performance With TRX50 + Quad Channel DDR5

medium

The AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO 9995WX, featuring 96 cores, is evaluated on a TRX50 platform with quad channel DDR5-6400 memory. The WRX90 motherboards support eight memory channels and offer more PCIe Gen 5 lanes compared to the TRX50.

  • AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO 9995WX
  • 96 cores
  • TRX50 platform with quad channel DDR5-6400 memory
  • WRX90 motherboards support eight memory channels
  • 128 PCIe Gen 5 lanes on WRX90 compared to 80 on TRX50
AMDDDR5TRX50Threadripper PRO 9995WXWRX90 motherboards

https://www.phoronix.com/review/amd-threadripper-9995wx-trx50

KDE Gear 25.08 Released With Improvements For Many KDE Apps

medium

The release of KDE Gear 25.08 includes several improvements for various KDE applications, such as Akonadi engine memory usage reduction and better integration with Microsoft InTune.

  • KDE Gear 25.08 released
  • Akonadi engine memory usage reduced by up to 75%
  • Better integration of Akonadi with Microsoft InTune for enterprise authentication
  • Improvements in Dolphin file manager
  • KRFB now supports non-European alphabets
  • Neochat program allows creating polls
  • KDE Itinerary travel app lets users manually enter train or bus trips
AkonadiDolphin file managerKDE GearKDE ItineraryKRFBNeochat

https://www.phoronix.com/news/KDE-Gear-25.08

AMDXDNA Improvements & New Rockchip NPU Accelerator Driver For Linux 6.18

medium

Today's first drm-misc-next pull for the Linux 6.18 cycle includes now defaulting to using the NVIDIA GSP firmware by the Nouveau driver. This change affects Turing and Ampere GPUs and should lead to a better experience for open-source NVIDIA users in just defaulting to the GSP firmware rather than leaving it an option. The other notable change is merging the Rocket driver as the open-source, reverse-engineered Rockchip NPU driver.

  • NVIDIA GSP firmware now defaults with Nouveau driver
  • Affects Turing and Ampere GPUs
  • Rocket driver for Rockchip NPU merged into Linux 6.18
  • User-space support ready for Mesa 25.3 atop the Teflon framework
Ampere GPUsLinuxNVIDIA GSP firmwareRockchip NPURocket driverTuring GPUsdrm-misc-next

https://www.phoronix.com/news/DRM-Misc-Next-Linux-6.18

LibreOffice 26.2 To Better Handle Documents With Restricted Embedded Fonts

medium

LibreOffice 26.2 will better handle documents with restricted embedded fonts by implementing an infobar to inform users when some fonts cannot be loaded due to licensing restrictions.

  • LibreOffice 26.2
  • EmbeddedFontsHelper::sufficientTTFRights
  • infobar implementation
  • restricted licensing rights
26.2LibreOfficeinfobarrestricted fonts

Linux 6.18 With Nouveau Driver Will Default To Using GSP Firmware

medium

The Nouveau driver beginning on the Linux 6.18 kernel will begin using the GPU System Processor (GSP) firmware by default but still have a fallback in place in case that firmware isn't supported.

  • Nouveau Driver
  • Linux Kernel 6.18
  • GPU System Processor (GSP) Firmware
  • Default Usage of GSP Firmware
  • Fallback to Old Firmware if Necessary
GSP FirmwareLinux KernelNouveau DriverRTX 20 GPUs

[$] LWN.net Weekly Edition for August 14, 2025

low

SR-IOV Support Limited to Intel Arc Pro Graphics Cards

medium

Intel has confirmed that SR-IOV support will only be available on their professional product SKUs, specifically the Arc Pro graphics cards. This decision affects users who were hoping for SR-IOV support on consumer Battlemage graphics cards such as the Arc B580 and Arc B570.

  • SR-IOV will only be supported on Intel Arc Pro Graphics Cards
  • Support is not available for consumer Battlemage graphics cards like the Arc B580 and Arc B570
  • Intel's decision aligns with AMD and NVIDIA, where SR-IOV support is also limited to professional product SKUs
Battlemage GPUsIntel Arc Pro Graphics CardsLinux KernelProject BattlematrixSR-IOV

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-SR-IOV-Only-For-Arc-Pro

Linux Preps For New 'SoC Power Slider' With Upcoming Panther Lake

medium

The SoC Power Slider feature, introduced with Panther Lake hardware, adds support for system-wide energy performance preferences using a slider interface defined via processor thermal PCI device MMIO space. This feature piggy-backs off the Linux platform profile API and provides three power profile choices: 'performance', 'balanced', and 'low-power'.

  • SoC Power Slider is introduced with Panther Lake hardware
  • Support for system-wide energy performance preferences using a slider interface
  • Piggy-backs off the Linux platform profile API
  • Three power profile choices: 'performance', 'balanced', and 'low-power'
Energy Performance PreferencesLinuxPanther LakePlatform Profile APISoC Power Slider

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-Panther-Lake-Power-Slider

Linux Lands Fix For Early 6.17 Regression Causing 37~43% Performance Hit

low

NGINX Adds Native Support for ACME Protocol

low

NGINX has announced the preview release of the nginx-acme module, which adds native support to NGINX for the Automatic Certificate Management Environment (ACME) protocol. This addition simplifies and enhances SSL/TLS certificate management by reducing manual errors and eliminating much of the ongoing overhead traditionally associated with managing these certificates.

  • Project/Component: nginx-acme module
  • Target Architecture: NGINX
  • Optimization/IR/Pass Name: N/A
  • Version/Release: Preview release
  • Regression/Performance Impact: Reduces manual errors and overhead, creates a more secure workflow with fewer vulnerabilities.
  • Related PR/Commit/Discussion Links: https://lwn.net/Articles/1033657/
NGINXACME ProtocolSSL/TLS Certificate Management

https://lwn.net/Articles/1033657/

Google Develops KFuzzTest For Fuzzing Internal Linux Kernel Functions

low

Intel ISPC 1.28 Adds Optimized Support For AMD Zen 4 & Zen 5 CPUs

medium

ISPC 1.28 brings some minor language changes, now supports ISPC usage as a C++ library for embedding ISPC compilation directly into applications, Python integration enhancements, new standard library functions and more vector types, and various optimizations and fixes.

  • ISPC-as-a-Library support includes experimental Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation
  • Optimized shuffle / shift / rotate and reduce_equal on AVX-512 targets up to a 90% speed-up
  • Adds AMD Zen 4 and Zen 5 target support for taking advantage of the processor's ISA capabilities
AMD Zen 4AMD Zen 5AVX-512ISPCJIT compilationperformance optimization

https://www.phoronix.com/news/Intel-ISPC-1.28

Rust 1.89.0 发布

medium

Rust 团队宣布了 Rust 的新版本 1.89.0。此版本引入了对显式推断 const 泛型参数的支持。

  • 项目/组件: Rust 编程语言
  • 优化/IR/Pass 名称: 显式推断 const 泛型参数支持
  • 版本/Release: 1.89.0
  • 相关 PR/Commit/讨论链接: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/08/07/Rust-1.89.0/

Rust Project Goals Update - Async Programming Improvements

medium

The Rust project is working on several goals to enhance support for asynchronous programming in the language.

  • Improved support for async-fn-in-traits, subsuming async-trait crate functionality
  • Progress towards sync and async generators to simplify iterator and data stream creation
  • Improvement of Pin ergonomics for lower-level async coding
Rustasync programmingproject goals
